name: change costume
content:
Changes the costume of a sprite or group of sprites.

This block can make a sprite look different without changing its location or properties.

examples.name: Example 1
examples.description: A costume change can be triggered by an event. For example, when the alien is pressed, it changes all the green fish costumes to pink fish costumes.

examples.name: Example 2
examples.description: Just one sprite can be changed by name. In this case, there is one alien pretending to be like the others. When that alien clicked, it reveals its true self.

palette_params.name: costume
palette_params.description: Each Sprite Lab project or level will include some default sprite costumes, but you can also choose from a larger costume library or draw your own using the built-in pixel editor.

palette_params.name: sprite
palette_params.description: The sprite or group of sprites whose costume is changing

short_description: Changes the costume of a sprite or group of sprites.
